results.description:
In the, “Find Your Authentic Voice,” meetup you will learn to have the freest and most authentic expression of voice. You will experience greater capacity to be at your best consistently. With a special diaphragm target-training exercise you will be freeing body, strengthening breath support, calming you and clarifying voice you will be using your new capacity in group and individual exercises for instant integration of emotion and your creative mind. You will become a more resourceful presenter/performer, with exercises that are easy to understand and practice, effectively raising the bar on your ability. This meetup will always feel safe, be dynamic and a fun place to learn and grow. 
Benefits include: 
Public Speaking: More confidence and energy and a clearer mind to reach your audience with impact.
Nerves and Confidence: more oxygen to your brain means you will be calmer and think more clearly.
Legit Stage:  a stronger diaphragm means more easy projection, more energy and emotional dynamics in your voice whether speaking or singing.
Film and TV: having more mental energy gives you more authentic expression and better/faster interpretation of direction.
Auditions: being more energized and focused means you will prepare sides faster and better.
Casting Agent Interviews:  being more relaxed and connected to your feelings and passion comes across as confidence.
results.name: Find Your Authentic Voice - For Actors, Speakers & Singers

results.description: Staten Island Arts Folklife program is dedicated to the preservation,promotion, and safeguarding of traditional arts, through programming and technical assistance. These art forms are the fabric of cultural heritage and represent an important grassroots dimension of the cultural sector. On Staten Island, examples of these expressions can be found in the architecture of Our Lady of Mount Carmel Grotto, the performance of Liberian folktales being told in their native dialects, the distribution of Sri Lankan foodways through markets and restaurants, the ritual and celebration of Mexican Independence Day, and the occupational traditions that preserve one of the city’s last working waterfront. This Meetup group will be used to share traditional arts initiatives throughout Staten Island and beyond. It will also serve as a space to share knowledge and resources for making the traditional arts stronger on Staten Island. If you have any questions, please e-mail our regional and county folklorist, Christopher J. Mulé at cmule@statenislandarts.org or call (718) 447-3329 ext. 1006.
results.name: Staten Island Arts Folklife

results.description:
ALL DETAILS HERE, also this is where you should submit your music/performance proposals for consideration.

What had started as a series of house concerts now becomes an opportunity for young musicians and composers to present their efforts to the public. 

Curated by NY-based conductor/composer Peter Breiner and based on the same concept as his house concerts, this series will be the result of the many encounters Breiner has had with local musicians, both professionally and personally. 

You would be hard-pressed to find greater evidence of NYC being a melting pot and a cultural/musical Mecca of the world. So far these concerts, consisting of a random collection of musicians, have always presented an incredibly high level of musicianship and artistry. The connections made at these events have serendipitously led to further collaborations and opportunities. 

Starting in January 2014, a beautiful space at Bohemian National Hall will be filled with music that is both contemporary and looking toward the future, trying to incorporate all the latest developments in technology while at the same time firmly rooted in musical traditions and connected to Czech musical culture. As an example, one of the concerts will present a Piano Trio by Bedrich Smetana and also a Cello Sonata by 22-year-old composer Kristina Smetana. 

Connections like this one will be at the heart of the dramaturgy of the series while at the same time putting out a call for new pieces and musicians and try to fit them into the random flow of events called life. Concerts of the series will take place (with a few exceptions) on the last Friday of each month for as long as the serendipity continues to work. 

As a part of the evening, we will also have talks and discussions—perhaps even panels—about the future of classical music, with some prominent and very interesting speakers. 

We are not setting any age limits, but we want to gear the series towards young composers and musicians (young at heart could also qualify).
results.name: New York's Sounds of Serendipity

results.description:
Crowdfunding is an industry that many Americans know little about.  Let's begin with what Crowdfunding is exactly:


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rTRqaAlZ2Hs

Reality Crowd TV is a grassroots movement that is not only occurring in the United States, but all around the globe.  We are creating a Reality TV Show around the Crowdfunding Movement that will be Crowdfunded.

What is our Mission?

To Inform, Educate, Inspire, and Motivate Entrepreneurs Worldwide to Start Small Businesses through Crowdfunding, and Provide the Blueprint on How to Crowdfund.

What is the Purpose of this Meetup?

We will be hosting events across the country as part of our Nationwide Tour to Inform America, and subsequently the globe, about Reality Crowd TV's mission and about Crowdfunding in general:

American Tour Press Release

World Tour Press Release

Who is behind this Meetup Group?

Manolis Sfinarolakis is the Founder & Creator of Reality Crowd TV.

Jessica Sun is the CEO of Reality Crowd TV.

What's in it for you?  Why should you join?

We aim to use this meetup group to accomplish two goals:

• To assist us in organizing our nationwide and worldwide tour schedule

• To inform, educate, inspire, and motivate entrepreneurs worldwide to start small businesses through Crowdfunding and provide them a blueprint on how to Crowdfund.

We will provide our members with PRACTICAL, not THEORETICAL advice on how to Crowdfund as we ourselves have prepared for three months to launch our own Crowdfunding campaign.  

We by no means consider ourselves experts but we do have lessons learned that we would love to share with our members in a non-judgement free environment.  Too many people are making themselves out to be experts without ever having the experience of Crowdfunding under their belt.  

Our meetup group seeks to provide you with actionable knowledge and information from day 1.  We check the theory at the door and focus on what will make you successful in your own endeavors.  We hope we are making this abundantly clear, we want people to join us who GET THINGS DONE! 

Our Channels of Communication

http://www.realitycrowdtv.com

http://www.facebook.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.twitter.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.youtube.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.pinterest.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.instagram.com/realitycrowdtv

https://plus.google.com/+Realitycrowdtv
results.name: Virtual Crowdfunding Meetup by Reality Crowd TV

results.description:
The Sunday Night Supper Club was created specifically for "Couples Over 40" who enjoy trying out new area restaurants (as well as the tried and true) while meeting new people and making new friends in the process. We currently schedule brunches and dinners two Sundays a month and while we mostly stay in Stamford, all of Fairfield County is fair game -- and we love getting restaurant suggestions from members. 

Our club is in its second year and is slowly, but steadily growing. We couldn't be happier with the membership we've attracted -- there's been so much great food and great conversation shared by an interesting, friendly, and diverse group of people who we honestly can't even imagine never having met. 

One important note: We are all about participation. We'd rather be a small group of people who participate, than have hundreds of members who don't. So be prepared to join in if you join; otherwise, what's the point, right?

We hope to meet you soon!

Cheers,

Donna


Note: We generally hold the reservations to a maximum of 14 people (or seven couples) for each meetup, just to make it manageable for the restaurant, so if you see a meetup posted that you want to attend, please RSVP early to ensure a seat at the table :)
results.name: Sunday Night Supper Club

results.description:
We are dynamic, multi-faceted, exquisitely messy creatures.

Confined and defined by normalcy, stereotypes, and protection of the status quo... it can feel as if the only choice is to fit in or be an outcast.

At war with our self and the world, we learn to hide certain parts, presenting only the pre-packaged versions that are acceptable. Even if we express 99% truth, we keep the most vulnerable parts locked away where no one can find them.

The thing is…

What if the very parts we hide are the best parts of us? What if those parts are what makes each of us extraordinary? The undefinable “something” each one of us has. What if sharing our unique quirks and connecting with others who appreciate them is the key to unlock joy, love, acceptance, and success in life?


At Living Quirky, this is why we celebrate a new way of being. We’re freer than ever to be who we are. Expanding far beyond the conventionally labeled boxes that have confined us.

So, if we're all different, what connects us?

Unified by a declaration, a commitment to respect and accept ALL of who we are.

We choose to relate to our self with deeper truth and unconditional love.

We choose to cheer each other on in celebration of our diversity.

We choose to belong, centered in the peace of our QuirkPower.

--> Read more of our Declaration of the QuirkNation by clicking here!


We love Meetup as a platform for connecting as a community in real life, in New York City. 

Deciding to focus on quality over quantity, we offer 3 event types every month:

1. The Quirk Games - social connection around card + board games and getting to know each other.

2. The Quirk Thing: A Stage for the Unconventional - show&tell meets story-time meets talent show. Inspiration + expression.

3. Quirkshops - ... coming soon in January or February!


At our events, we foster an atmosphere centered around:

- Curiosity, playfulness, joy... where we delight in our expressions and embrace the spirit of adventure.

- Appreciation, kindness, love... where we embrace the out of the ordinary and honor all shades and varieties of humanity.

- Courage, vulnerability, imagination... where we surrender what "should" or "should not" be and invite the wiggly, mysteries of life.


We are Living Quirky. The Quirksters of the QuirkNation. And, we wholeheartedly welcome you into our Quirkdom! With oodles of wiggle room to relax, breathe, and to explore fully and deeply.


Join us in NYC + online at LivingQuirky.com!!! Cheers to connecting!
results.name: Living Quirky in NYC

We all stand on the shoulders of giants; existing projects like unfiltered and kafka and scalding, to name just a few, allow us to build {more,better,faster} systems. Helping open source helps all of us. It's also a great way to meet other like-minded people and to improve as a developer.

At the meetup itself, we work together to help these projects by fixing bugs, adding documentation, and adding features. So bring a laptop and come ready to write some code!

results.description:
This free Meetup is being formed to acquaint you to one of Long Island's oldest outdoor organizations: The Nassau Hiking and Outdoor Club or NHOC. (NHOC) is an organization of over 400 members from every walk of life, who share a common appreciation of the outdoors. There's something for everyone at NHOC. Aside from hiking, the club is involved with many activities including camping, walking, horseback riding, bicycling, picnicking, and just about anything which broadens knowledge of and respect for nature. Some members participate in trail maintenance and other conservation efforts. During the winter months, indoor as well as outdoor activities are offered. All hikes and activities are graded on their level of difficulty - from easy ("C") to challenging ("A"). We are a friendly, social group looking for new members.  Many of our members fall into the SINGLES category and there is no better way to find new friends than by participating in an activity that you love. If you decide to become a full paying member of NHOC, you will receive our Shorelines publication several times throughout the year, informing you of all of our activities. We organize 15-30 hikes per month throughout the New York area. Parties, social gatherings, city walks, movie nights, bowling, and weekend trips are only some of the wide range of activities that we plan for our members. Annual dues is only $30 (Individual) or $40 (Family). 

As a Meetup member, you may join us for 2 hikes before becoming a full paying member of NHOC.

Here is link to our membership form: 

  http://www.nassauhiking.org/NHOCMembership_form_2014.pdf

For more information, here is a link to our website:

http://www.nassauhiking.org
results.name: Nassau Hiking and Outdoor Club (NHOC)

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in learning Italian having fun, kind of an HAPPY HOUR where you 'drink' a rich and beautiful culture with an experienced native Tutor. 

All skills levels are welcome since there will be 3 groups: Beginners- Intermediate- Advanced (book clubs) When possible or requested, we'll go to museums and Italian institutes for exhibitions and events. I start this group to combine language and culture (with readings, speaking, conversations, games) and planning trips to inland Italy, a non-conventional Tourism. 

Each member will become an expert, really close to become a real Italian. Looking forward to exploring il BEL PAESE with real passion, going in depth, teaching the tricks to learn fast, tailoring gatherings and classes on your personal interests (arts, archaeology, history, cinema, opera, literature etc.).” You will love this new adventure!! 

Where? Midtown Manhattan. Also in Queens, near Sunnyside or Queensboro Plaza, upon request only.


   SCHEDULE: Every day. If you don't see a class on the calendar, ask for a lesson or make a suggestion to involve more people

- NEW! For private lessons one-on-one (1 hour and 15 minutes): contact me ;-)

I provide with copies each time, I come with an Agenda, but feel free to bring any book of your interest

For the Advanced ones: we will also decide together what Italian book we will read loud and go in depth (both the text work and the social-economical and political context):  DANTE, MACHIAVELLI, MANZONI, LEOPARDI, MORAVIA, ORIANA FALLACI, SAVIANO etc.

Do you have a favorite one? Aren't you curious to see how the PRINCE of Machiavelli is so modern nowadays? 

What about Mrs. Fallaci and her predictions on Islam in Europe? Where she was right and where wrong? How will you describe her style? How will you feel after reading her?

And what about a pessimist like LEOPARDI living in an always-positive country like ITALY? Why is he becoming more popular and translated worldwide?

Also.....have you ever dreamed of going to ITALY and visiting a magic place which is inland, rich of culture and tradition and beauty...with a well-educated native that knows your interests and hobbies?? With Authentic Italy your Private Tutor is also your Travel Planner and your adventure pal!! Are you ready for this amazing journey?? I am ;-)

Get involved, start this journey, it might change your life's philosophy and approach. There's a bit of Italy in each of us ;-)

Grazie e a presto. 

Valentina
results.name: AUTHENTIC ITALY=with a NATIVE. Language& cultural Tours!!

results.description: The Classical Musicians' Rehearsal Symphony Orchestra, LLC, is a membership symphony composed of professional-level musicians who play just for the love of it.  A rehearsal symphony, sometimes called a "reading" orchestra, is a musical organization whose focus is on playing simply for the love of it, pursuing performance-level achievement, absent the administrative and financial pressures associated with public concert performance.  Auditions are not required.  All accomplished instrumentalists — professional and amateur, irrespective of age, experience, or walk of life — who share a love of classical music and the desire to make music with like-minded musicians are welcome to belong.  Rehearsals are held at various times and locations in Manhattan, NYC, as posted at www.rehearsalsymphony.com.  Also posted is a schedule of classics we will be playing.  Seating is not competitive; firsts and seconds reverse positions at each rehearsal of each work.  We are not concerned with imbalances in membership or attendance; e.g., many flutists, few violists.  We play, just for the love of it!  RSVP is requested so we can provide parts in advance of each rehearsal.
results.name: The Classical Musicians' Rehearsal Symphony Orchestra, LLC

results.description:
Hola a todos!

Purpose of our group: This group is for people who want to improve their Spanish or English.

What members should expect from the group: Organizers of this group will make sure that members are learning in a non-intimidating atmosphere and most importantly, that everyone has fun while learning. This group is meant to be fun and social but we really like to stress the importance of practicing English and Spanish.

What organizers expect from the members: As this is not an instruction-based group, members need to be at least at a conversational level. Members are expected to fully participate and converse in English and Spanish. Please be considerate and practice both languages.

Additional: We keep this group small for a reason. We believe that in smaller groups, each individual learner has more of a chance to speak up. Especially for those who are shy. We also believe that members benefit the most in smaller groups and have the opportunity to talk to each and every member.
results.name: Queens Spanish & English Conversation Exchange

results.description:
This is a Fantastic Social Group for Men & Women in their 40's & 50's, to form new friendships in and have fun!  Let's meet each other, share our passions, and create great times together.  I'd like to meet new friends who are available, adventurous, reliable and kind.  Do you want the same?  Are you looking to form solid friendships & experience fun times with people in your own age group? 

NO-SHOWS:  AFTER TWO, you'll be removed from the group.  Please keep your RSVP'S UPDATED and Cancel up to ONE DAY PRIOR, if you need to.  If you Cancel at the last min which prevents someone else from going, it'll be considered a 'no show' (except in an emergency.)         

My cell # is always listed on my posts--Please call/text if you are going to be late instead of posting a message on the Meetup site (which I won't see.)  You have chosen a 'Great, Friendly & Fun Group!'  :-) 

This meetup began centered around 'Hicksville' for most events, but now has branched out mainly to anywhere in Nassau with some events held in Suffolk, and NYC occasionally.  If you have attended at least three meetups and are interested in becoming an EVENT HOST please let me know.  I try to offer a variety of fun activities with friendly people!  I am also open to any new suggestions that you may have for the group.  

A $5.00 meetup fee will be collected at your second event, to help with meetup costs.  You can come once, for free, to check out the people and events to see if you feel comfortable with the group. Thanks, See you soon!

results.description:
About Us

3WCircle provides a platform for women to redefine success, happiness and connection.

Our members are entrepreneurs, stay at home moms, thinkers and innovators.  Despite our unique backgrounds, our desire to be introspective and honest is what ties our circle together.

Through our events, expert-led discussions and online articles, members can grow, evolve and be inspired by exposure to different perspectives.  Authentic connections, real conversations and moments of self-actualization are part of the 3W experience.

All women who are introspective can engage in the conversation whether they are forming a new business or starting a family. Moms, CEO’s, innovators, and entrepreneurs come together to talk as women not as professionals.

Membership

Our events are for members only.  Members are admitted after completing an application.  You will be prompted to answer our 3 question application when you join our Meetup Group.  

Our membership criteria include authenticity, openness and a willingness to connect with others.
results.name: 3WCircle

Also, we have a new policy. It's called the "No Fly On The Wall Policy". This means that you have to book one event every thirty days to stay in the group. We don't need people looking at the pictures or event dates. What we do need is, for everybody to come out and start enjoying life. 

If you RSVP to an event, please try your best to attend. We are about unity so, we don't want to wait for someone that's not coming. Five no-shows will get you removed from the group.  If your not going to make it, comment on the event or email/text me.

results.description:
Join us… a patient-driven support community for people suffering from Hashimoto's Thyroiditis. We, the Hashimoto's Awareness Organization raise awareness of the disease connecting people to proper testing for early diagnosis. We believe Hashimoto's Thyroiditis is reversible through a holistic approach to treatment. We are a source of education, advocacy, and directly connected to the latest research nationwide to inspire and enable people to live a symptom free life. 


We meet once a month and invite key note speakers/experts in the field on healing Hashimoto's disease. At the meetup you will:

 *Learn from other people’s successful experiences 

 *Discover treatment approaches and information you may not know about

 *Be empowered by asking for and receiving support

 *Share your personal story 

 *Develop a sense of community. 


You are not alone. Whether you have been dealing with this disorder for many years or have been recently diagnosed, join us for an evening of great conversation and support. Together we will create the possibility of making a life changing difference for you and others. We will meet twice a month, create a network via Internet if desired, and in the future, provide opportunity and training for those interested in creating similar support groups in other areas or cities. 

Fabienne Heymans, Pearl Thomas & Joseph Campos and our wonderful Board of Advisors.
results.name: Hashimoto's Awareness

topics.name: Support for Those Who Have Lost a Child to Suicide

results.description: The Samaritans of New York, a non-religious, non-profit organization in New York City offers free bereavement support groups for individuals who have lost a loved one to suicide who seek a safe and supportive environment where they can talk about their thoughts and feelings and share their experiences tied to their loss in the company of other people who have had similar experiences. The meetings are free and offered twice a month on weekday evenings at convenient Manhattan locations. The meetings are only open to those who have lost a loved one to suicide and participants must be at least 18 years of age to attend. If you are interested in attending a support group meeting, please visit http://samaritansnyc.org/coping-with-suicide-loss/ to learn more about the meetings, meeting dates and locations. Alternatively, you can call Samaritans Safe Place program at (212) 673-3041 to receive further information about meetings, dates and sites. In your voicemail message, please leave your full contact information and the best time to reach you and someone from the program will get in touch with you.
results.name: Support Group for Survivors of Suicide Loss

results.description:
This group is for women ages 25-45 who live around the downtown Brooklyn (Carroll Gardens-Borum Hill-Cobble Hill-Brooklyn Heights-Park Slope) area. It's a book club first and foremost but also a place to meet other women, create friendships and have a glass (or four) of wine. Books we read can be suggested by the group and cover a range of topics. Please come to this group with a sense of humor and don't take it too seriously. Lets casually discuss our book, get a little tipsy and make lasting friendships in the area.

Because my goal is to create real friendships and a group that gets together regularly, please RSVP for all events-- even if you can't attend. If the days I choose don't work for you-- I want to know! I'll be limiting the number of women who join so that we can be a successful group. It should also be said that participation is expected. Members who don't attend a meetup within 6 months, regularly no show or RSVP will be removed. That is just to keep a small active group of women who know one another and have great conversation. My email is always available if anyone has ideas, suggestions or issues. I love hearing from you!!

This meetup is intended for writers of short fiction and nonfiction who are looking to grow and to take their writing to the next level. We focus on giving effective critiques and also on applying these points to our prose. Most of all, we focus on the specific strategies and techniques that will turn our thoughtful musings into finished work.

This writing group emphasizes process. Please bring an initial draft of no more than 750 words double-spaced of your writing that you would like to develop, refine and polish, (and ultimately publish). Bring copies for the group. It is the goal of this group that every participant create at least one finished piece.

Toastmasters is the most experienced organization in the field of public speaking and leadership training in the world today and at a price that is so economical that it will blow you away! results.description:
TAD (Telecom Application Developer) Meetup and TADHack (TAD Hackathon) NY/NJ is for all developers and engineers who are interested in helping to evolve communications technologies and practices. Telecom application developers include: telco independent software vendors, system integrators, enterprise developers and many other developers building apps that live either in the core telecom network, enterprise data centers or public cloud. Check out TADHack.com.

Whether you have expertise in development, telecom engineering, mobile technologies, or business, if you share our passion for innovation and disruption come join us at a local TAD Meetup and help facilitate new emerging markets for IP-enabled communications applications.

Some of the technologies discussed include:
Telecom APIs (including any IP based communication services; video communications; rich communications services; the good old PSTN; etc.)
WebRTC (Web Real Time Communications)
CRBT (Call Ring Back Tone) APIs
In-Call services, that is new services within the call made possible through IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem)
SMS/USSD applications for developing markets and e-inclusion such as mobile payments, banking, e-commerce, bitcoin for emerging markets, etc.
Converged applications, e.g. taking the idea of Amazon Mayday, and embedding customer experience management everywhere
In-network services, including NFV (Network Function Virtualization) and SDN (Software Defined Networks)
Business vertical focused applications in healthcare, automotive, government, entertainment, financial, customer care, etc.
Internet of things, high speed fiber-based services, mash-ups across themes, really anywhere you think telecoms can make life better.
results.name: TADMeetup and TADHack NY/NJ

results.description:
The AKQA TECH.insight mission is to inspire and facilitate invention with software for artists and engineers in NYC and around the world.

A group that meets at the AKQA NY office to share code and software solutions that we find inspiring and innovative.  This group is all about code, technology, solving software problems, and inventing with software over food and drinks.  

The group is not about recruiting, PR, AKQA or our clients, although we often use our client work as examples because that's what we know best.  

Some simple rules: bring an inquisitive and open mind, share, contribute, and be ready to talk about code.
results.name: AKQA NY TECH.insight

results.description:
Hi Everyone,


This Meetup offers busy, active people the chance to experience the practices of yoga and meditation in a comfortable, supportive and safe environment designed to help build awareness, concentration and enhance well-being.

Group is taught by me, Joan Stenzler, an experienced Kripalu Yoga teacher in Fresh Meadows. I offer Gentle Yoga classes, Meditation groups and Wellness-oriented experiential workshops and programs. I hope that you will come and try one my programs for yourself and bring a friend along!

Please know that while I do offer some groups at no charge, most of these sessions are designed to introduce students to my 8-Week Yoga Classes and upcoming Wellness Workshops and Classes.

So while some yoga classes will be FR*EE, once you come and see if you like it , you would then need to decide if you wanted to join my Yoga class series for which there is a charge. (The same is true to my Meditation & Wellness Workshops.)

I offer a discount of $20 off to my Meetup members who decide to register for my Yoga Series after a  FR*EE session, as a way to support your participation and still cover my costs.

It is simply impossible for me to hold this group without charging and still cover my expenses.

PLEASE KNOW THAT THE PURPOSE OF THIS GROUP IS TO GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND EXPAND IT THROUGH DEDICATED PRACTICE AND CONVERSATION.

This is not a group to join if you are looking meet people in order to pursue romantic encounters.

Please respect this guideline if you do decide to come to enable all group members can have a safe and comfortable experience! Thank you for your understanding.

I look forward to meeting some of you in class soon!

Joan Stenzler
Professional Level Kripalu Yoga Teacher
results.name: Gentle Yoga and Meditation in Fresh Meadows

results.description: Hi I"m Tammy. I had a folk meetup for 4 years which I loved hosting in my office loft in the Village It got too big. So its reincarnation is this one. 20 folks singers (at each meetup) to play and sing traditional folk music one Sunday afternoon a month. We need a fair number of skilled acoustic musicians - guitar, banjo, mandolin, etc. The music: traditional and 60s/70s folk with some old country thrown in. A bit of bluegrass and modern folk too. Coffe and tea served. Snacks volunteered. Music provided and projected on the wall to follow along. Music additions and volunteers welcome. This is not for new singer songwriters or old rock/pop. And it is by invitation only to keep it small and intimate. And fun. And to fit the smaller space. Same as before for those who used to come, smaller living room space.

If you follow or want to explore positive, constructive and spiritually nourishing paths: Wicca, Pagen, Root Work, Witch Craft, Shamanism, the 3 books of the Bible, Tao, Buddhist, Nihilism or Atheist and & all in-between Alchemy Moderne is open to you. 

Alchemy Moderne is an open exchange, clearing house, forum, and education platform where all can learn, grow and enjoy.   

Alchemy Moderne features informative, interactive workshops, free hobnobs, interesting field trips & exploration.   All workshops center on safe and productive techniques of the Mystic and include many different tools, pathways and languages to allow participants to explore, embrace and master each topic.  From Tarot to Astrology, Crystals, Minerals & Gemstones to Totems, Astral Projection to Intuition, Elixirs & Infusion to Qi movement: Alchemy Moderne's workshop foster illumination and exploration.   

Alchemy Moderne Workshops are created and taught by B.Ber, Metaphysical Practitioner, Mystic and Professional Healer.  

            ~Come surf universal energy in respect, cooperation and enjoyment~


All the best,

JP & B

please note: Alchemy Moderne is a safe haven: any and all soliciting their services; proselytize/recruit for their Master/Guru, Faith &/or Organization or behave in a predatory manner will be removed & banned from this Meetup group.   

If you're interested in sponsorship, paying for workshop or supporting the group, please contact the administrators and do not send money to this site.  Thanks for your interest!

topics.name: Support Group for Adults With BPD
How do I deal with a family member who has BPD

results.description:
Finally, a supportive and safe place to learn about BPD... This year, for the first time, TARA has convened Get the Facts about BPD: Support and Psychoeducation group for people coping with BPD. These courageous people are sharing the shame and sense of failure that dominates their every day as they live from crisis to crisis. TARA's group has enabled these people, living in loneliness and pain to come together in safety, share their stories and find strength in a common bond of shared suffering and understanding. 

If you have been diagnosed with BPD or are exploring the possibility that you might have the disorder, join us for learning, support and conversation. This peer-focused group is practical and solution-oriented. It is neither group therapy nor a support group nor is it a substitute for treatment. 

We at TARA admire those who take the brave step into evidence-based treatment for BPD, despite countless failures and begin to find relief. Their stories are showing us how profound the isolation and pain of living with BPD is and how much more we all need to do to help them live their lives with less pain. Learn more about our work at www.tara4bpd.org
results.name: NYC Get the Facts about BPD: Support & Education TARA Meetup

results.description: The Oscar® and Emmy® Award-winning Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers® (SMPTE®), a professional membership association, is the worldwide leader in developing and providing motion-imaging standards and education for the communications, technology, media, and entertainment industries. An internationally recognized and accredited organization, SMPTE advances moving-imagery education and engineering across the broadband, broadcast, cinema, and IT disciplines. Since its founding in 1916, SMPTE has published the SMPTE Motion Imaging Journal and developed more than 650 standards, recommended practices, and engineering guidelines. More than 6,000 members — motion-imaging executives, engineers, creative and technology professionals, researchers, scientists, educators, and students— who meet in Sections throughout the world, sustain the Society. Sections are the face of SMPTE to many of our members – a great resource for educational programming, technical expertise, and networking . Currently, SMPTE has 27 local sections worldwide, which host more than 200 meetings, tutorials and workshops each year. The New York Section elects officers that plan local technical programs, tailoring the programming to the interests of the NY audience and our available resources.
results.name: SMPTE ® New York Section

results.description:
What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.


Sign up to our Couchase Developer newsletter

About Wearable Wednesday NY

Wearable Wednesday NY was founded by Paul Farkas to explore, recognize, and highlight key brands and thoughleaders in Wearable Tech. 

In association with Wearable World Inc. Wearable Wednesday events are an open community forum focused on the blending of technology, art and humanity in the Wearable Technology and Internet of Things ecosystem.  Our goal is to provide a platform for industry innovators, entrepreneurs, builders and investors to connect with like-minded, motivated people with the knowledge, vision and partnerships that will move the Internet of Wearable Things ecosystem forward. Group Meetups will include both technical and market-oriented sessions. Wearable Wednesdays are held globally across the world’s top tech centers, including San Francisco, New York, Dallas and London, and we continue to launch new locations periodically. Meet the most innovative wearable tech entrepreneurs in your community, demo products, share ideas and discuss trends in both local and global markets. http://wearableworld.co/

Or is the truth that many artists live in the Bronx, but are forced to travel to Manhattan, Brooklyn & Queens, because they themselves believe that there is no "art scene" in their home town. What if we decided to stop traveling? What if we decided to settle our roots and show people what the Bronx Art scene is really about?

results.description:
The best part of the StartupBus phenomenon is the awesome community that it has created. This meetup is here to make it easy for the New York community to hold events, to stay connected, and to continue fostering entrepreneurship in our region!

---

Founded in 2010, StartupBus is building a global entrepreneurial ecosystem through unique experiences and inspirational connections. We are a community run organization, primarily staffed with unpaid volunteers; our underlying vision with all activities is to empower the people that create change in the world and disrupt the status quo, in order to create a better life for all. Our worldwide members routinely participate in and organize events of all kinds in order to further cultivate entrepreneurship and innovation in their local regions.

StartupBus also produces the most intense startup competition in the world, where top talent from across the planet compete as 'Buspreneurs' to build the next generation of startup companies over the course of a multi-day road trip. Our 1,000+ member global network runs these competitions on nearly every continent.

http://startupbus.com/

Please read our About page to see our guidelines for membership in this Meetup.

results.description:
The English Language Instruction Meetup:

This is an English Language Instruction group for Asians who are learning or mastering the English language.


The groups members come from many East Asian nations (China, Japan, and Korea especially). We welcome members from other countries also.  There are many members from countries such as India, Mongolia, Thailand, etc..   There are also many Columbia and NYU students, and Asians who are doing Internships in America.  The members stay in Brooklyn, Manhattan, New Jersey, and Queens.  This group offers these English Learners a way to learn English in a fun, social environment, that is outside of their normal school and/or workplace.

This is an opportunity for everyone who is Asian and has not mastered the English language to practice the art of conversation and speaking English in groups.   This group allows you to meet, socialize, and build English speaking skills, listening skills, and confidence with the English language.  This is all accomplished in an environment with like minded Asian English learners.

This is an excellent group if you want to:  Learn English - Find Asian Friends in New York - Learn American Culture - Spend the Holidays with Other Visiting Asians - Go to Karaoke - Learn to sing Karaoke in English!

Join us and meet fellow Asian English learners.  We have formal and informal introductions, and everybody gets a chance to talk.  The conversations are fun, relaxed, and are organized by a native English speaker who makes sure everybody is talking and learning English conversation skills.

This is a meetup for Asians in and near Manhattan that want to learn and work on their English language skills!

OUR REGULAR EVENTS ARE:

• English Conversation Practice for Asians (FREE!). - 3rd Saturday of every month.

• English Conversation Practice for Asians Intensive ($10). - 1st, 2nd, and 4th Saturday of every month.

• English Conversation parties and holidays (FREE!).  - The holiday events are scheduled as holidays appear on the calendar.  We have events for American and Asian holidays.

• Art Galleries (FREE!)

• Music Concerts (Cost Varies)

• Dance Parties (FREE!)

• Karaoke Events ($6-$15 an hour)

• Restaurant Socials

• TOEFL Tutoring

• Museum Trips to the Museum of Natural History and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. ($1.00 Museum entry cost). - We go to the museum about once every 3 months.

• Annual Ski and Snowboard Trip ($150-$300)

• English Conversation and Vocabulary Intensive for Bankers, Economist, and Financial workers.  ($25) - This event is once a month.

If you are interested in an event, but do not see it listed on our calendar, send me an message.


/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/



Below are descriptions of a few of our English Language Events:

_______________________________________________________________________________________________
ENGLISH CONVERSATION FOR ASIANS PRACTICE  - (THIS EVENT IS FREE!) 

Lessons:  We practice English greetings, introductory conversations, social chit chat, and describing and identifying ourselves.  We have informal and formal conversations.  We talk for an 1 hour and 15 minutes, take a rest, and then talk again.  We have plenty of networking time, and it is easy to make new friends.  After the meetup, some of us usually get lunch. 

The group has a large number of Asians (Female and Male) from; China, Japan, and Korea, who arrived in America less than a month before coming to the meetup.  They are eager to meet other Asians who are new to the New York area in order to find new friends.  We teach them basic conversation and networking skills and we show them how to strengthen their core English conversation abilities.

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is FREE!

Time: 12 noon - 3pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: The third Saturday of every month.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations.   

Place: To be announced the first Saturday of every month.  We are usually going to meet midtown in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  You can check our meetup page for the address and directions.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION INTENSIVE

Lessons: We practice English greetings, conversations, social chit chat, and describing and identifying ourselves.  We have many formal and some informal conversations.  This is a 7 hour meetup.  We have plenty of networking time, and it is easy to make new friends.  This meetup is similar to our 3 hour meetup, only it is more intensive.  The group size is smaller and there is emphasis on the individual student and their specific needs and problems.  There is also more time for making friends.  We cover significantly more material than in our 3 hour group.  This is a meetup specially suited for people who want to learn English quickly or who find it is going to be important for them to strengthen their English speaking abilities.

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is $10.00  We only have the intensive if 2 or more people register before the date of the Intensive.  We only allow 10 people to register for this event, so you should register early.

Time: 12 noon - 7pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: The first and fourth Saturday of every month.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations. 

Place: To be announced the first Saturday of every month.  We are usually going to meet around midtown on the West side, in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.  You can also check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

____________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION, PARTY and KARAOKE!

The English Conversation Party and Karaoke Meetup! We have English conversations and then party!. The rule is the topics for the conversations at our Parties have to be fun.  Topics during the Holiday parties are always about the holiday that is occurring.  We do this event for Holidays and for every season (Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn).  Every Holiday Meetup includes a 15 minutes description of the Holiday, its customs, and how the Holiday is celebrated in America.   You are also taught American cultural customs during the Holiday event. 

THE PURPOSE OF THESE EVENTS IS TO GIVE ASIANS WHO ARE NOT AMERICAN, A SENSE OF COMMUNITY AND A CHANCE TO CELEBRATE DURING THE  YEAR AND DURING THE HOLIDAYS.  PLEASE BRING YOUR FRIENDS, ROOMMATES, AND ESL BUDDIES!

ENGLISH CONVERSATION PARTY AND KARAOKE MEETUPS:

• Thanksgiving Dinner

• Christmas Party!

• Memorial Day Celebration!

• July 4th Celebration!

• Winter English Conversation Instruction and Party!

• Spring English Conversation and Party!

• Summer English Conversation Instruction and Party!

• Autumn English Conversation Instruction and Party!

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: These events are usually FREE, but each individual usually pays about $6.00 - $30.00 for karaoke, food, and drink.

Time: The time varies.

Date: The date varies.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations.  

Place: We usually have this event in Manhattan, New York's Korea Town at an Asian Lounge or Karaoke club. 

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and you can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

____________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION INTENSIVE FOR BANKERS, ECONOMISTS, AND FINANCE PROFESSIONALS!

Lessons:  This is our Intensive for Asian bankers, Asian economists, and Asian finance professionals.  You do not have to be a financial professional in order to join this meetup event! Asian English Learners who are interested in learning how to talk about money in English are allowed to come to the intensive.  We cover common Financial conversations, how to speak in English at meetings, financial terminology, and economic terms and ideas that are specific to the English language.  You are allowed to bring any materials and books that you would like to discuss. 

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is $25.00  We only have the intensive if 2 or more people register before the date of the Intensive.  We only allow 10 people to register for this event, so you should register early.

Time: 12 noon - 7pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: This event is repeated every month.

The Instructor:  Erik is the instructor for this Meetup.

Place:  This event is going to be in China Town or in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.   You can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.


 _______________________________________________________________________________________________

Hi Everybody,

When people come to the Meetup I usually say, "This is a really fun group.  Everybody has been very nice.  We enjoy talking to each other and it is an awesome way to meet people from many different Asian countries who are new to the city of Manhattan."  Don't be shy!  Come check us out and join us on a Saturday in order to find out for yourself.  We get many interesting men and women who enjoy talking, making new friends, and learning the English language.   - Erik

Thank you,

Erik

The English Language Instruction Meetup for Asians Organizer


Please be aware; The availability of English programs is subject to change at any time and the group only offers refunds if a Meetup is cancelled, not if you do not show up.
results.name: English Language Instruction Meetup for Asians!

results.description:
Welcome to the New York Asian Art, Asian Music, and Asian Hip Hop Meetup. 

The Group: This group was created to connect New York artists, Asian artists, Asian art fans, and Asian art collectors; with each other.   The groups goal is to create a stable social scene for Asian art appreciation and Asian art creation in New York.  We are creating relationships which are good for artists, casual art fans, and serious art industry professionals.  Though this group is made of many Asians, you do not need to be Asian to join this group.  Anybody is allowed to join and attend this groups events.  The only requirements being an interest in Asian Art and that you be respectful of the groups administration and its members.

The Art:  Anime, Asian Architecture, Asian Calligraphy (Including Asian Graffiti), Asian Dance, Asian Fashion, Asian Hip Hop (All 5 Elements), Asian Industrial Design,  Asian Interior Design,  Asian Music (Traditional and Modern), Asian Pop Culture (Chinese Pop, Japanese Pop, Korean Pop, Mongolian Pop, Taiwanese Pop), and Cosplay.

The Event Organizer:  Erik, the event organizer and an artist, is a Buddhist/Taoist.  Erik has experience being the organizer of 3 other Meetup groups for Asians.  Erik has created a passion for Asian Art, and religion by profession.  Erik is a teaches Buddhism, Taoism, and Kung Fu, in Manhattan, New York.  Erik has also worked in the New York art and music industry as a  professional.  Erik has over 6 years experience in the Electronic Music Industry, and over 10 years experience in the American Hip Hop industry.  Erik is a member of the New York Asian community, art scene, fashion scene, and is currently finishing the creation of a modern, religious based Buddhist/Taoist art portfolio.  Erik is also a talented Asian event promoter, and has hosted events in China Town, and Korea Town, in New York. 

The Events: Besides art trips and art lesson events, we are going to host; Asian Art Parties, Asian Art Gallery Shows, Asian Fashion Shows, and Asian Club Nights.  All members are encouraged to join us in creating our events.  If you have an event suggestion, please write Erik on the groups' home page.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

ASIAN POP AND HIP HOP PARTY! 

In order to get face time in, relax, network, and build a thriving Asian Art scene in New York; we have a social event every month on the 3rd Saturday.  The location is TBA every month.  Please join us!

Time: 7pm until we have had enough.

Date: The third Saturday of every month.

Location: TBA 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________
results.name: New York Asian Art, Asian Music, and Asian Hip Hop Meetup!

A way for Asians to get connected in New York!

The group meets the 3rd Saturday of every month and randomly throughout the year.  We have an Asian music DJ that spins the latest and coolest Asian pop music and we are going to attend Asian cultural events around New York.

We ask that only Asians join this group.

ALL ASIANS ARE WELCOME!  We would like all Asians to join this group.  This includes East Asians, Indians, and Asians of mixed ethnic families.

Motivation:  To create the best Asian social meetup in the world!

Time: 7:00pm til Whenever we end the party!

Date: The third Saturday of every month, with less formal meetings sporadically announced.

Place:  Clubs, Lounges, and Awesome locations around Manhattan, New York!

Thanks you for joining.  I look forward to meeting you!




Erik

results.description:
TalentTech is a community of tech enthusiasts who are passionate about cutting-edge talent development technologies, research and businesses, in New York (and soon beyond!). The community meets monthly during one hour events that include technology demos, the latest research, corporate case studies and networking. 

Our monthly events focus on various aspects of the TalentTech Revolution: 

- Upstarts (and start-ups) challenging/disrupting/redefining the underlying technologies used by organizations today to acquire, manage and develop talent locally and globally

- Thinkers who are tinkering with new management, leadership, engagement and motivation paradigms by investigating the data found at the intersection of software and hardware @work and @play

- Explorers focused on understanding how to leverage technology to integrate a global/distributed workforce that spans three generations - Boomers, GenXers, and Millenials 

TalentTech is an independent forum and is open to anyone with a genuine interest in the topic
results.name: Talentedly

results.description:
This is a group for men and women interested in exploring Active Insight in workshops and groups. Active Insight is great for those who wish to begin or expand a mindfulness meditation practice, but have some challenge with sitting in silence for long periods (I think we all do!).  

Most workshops and groups begin being devoted to guided meditation and sharing, with the last portion being an OPTIONAL time to explore meditation through the arts such as: writing, art making, game playing, movement and sometimes even activities like bowling or flying trapeze!

Each Meetup has a different focus but the activities are always optional after the meditation and sharing.

Benefits of Mindfulness:

-Decrease stress and compulsions. 

-Increase concentration and overall happiness.

Benefits of Active Mindfulness through Activities:

-Taking risks expands our stress tolerance.

-Increased awareness of inner barriers, leading to better relationships.

-Pushing through fear allows for great confidence!

See you soon Mindful Powerhouses!

Adrienne
results.name: Active Insight: An Active Meditation Practice

You can participate at whatever level feels good to you. 

We're excited to meet you! 

Warmly,

The OneTaste New York Team

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”: that is, one of your own design! results.description:
"The only journey is the journey within"

This is a unique group incorporating mindfulness-meditation, expressive arts,  life coaching and various therapeutic techniques founded on the wellness model to promote health and wellbeing. 

This group is for you are interested in creating community with like-minded, heart-centered, men and women looking to live a wholehearted life from a grounded center. 

This group may be beneficial to you if you experience the following:

• intense stress or overwhelming feelings, 

• depression, low self-esteem and self-worth, 

• lack clarity & direction in your personal & professional life, 

• difficulties setting boundaries or saying no, 

• lack compassion for self and others, suffer from anxiety and stress related dis-ease,

• use ineffective and unhealthy strategies to cope with life challenges (i.e substance, food, sex, t.v, social media, spirituality, excercise)

• difficult interpersonal relationships

You will learn techniques and skills such as active meditation, mindfulness skills, meditation (active & sitting), movement, visualization, guided and unguided meditations, as well as use expressive arts modalities such as dance, music, art, painting, visual journaling and other experiential exercises to promote healing. 

The objective is to help you shift your state of mind from a place of "doingness" to a state of "beingness" -- grounded in love, clarity, peace, bliss and awakening. A place where you can make life choices that is authentic and aligned from a place of values, ownership, clarity, love and present-moment awareness. 

Master the whelm and live a life from a grounded center!


xo

Eva

results.description:
What is a "Rennie"?


In short: "Rennie" refers to people who are fans of Renaissance/Medieval Faires and Festivals.  We're not cast members, we're not market vendors...we're groupies.  Fans. Some are casual, only going once a year; others, like myself, go more often and have adopted a persona to portray (with outfit and accent to match) - but the main point is that we all love the magic of the Faire and that feeling as if we've gone back in time to an earlier place and century.

This group is meant to bring together people in the NYC area who have an interest in attending Renaissance Faires/Medieval Faires and related activities in and around city (or, for our purposes: Gotham.)  This includes our "home" festival in update Tuxedo Park, the New York Renaissance Faire, as well as those in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut.  It may also include events such as group outings to watch period or Fantasy related films and plays, or food and drink related to the early medieval-to late Renaissance eras.

Maybe you've thought about attending one, but don't know anyone else interested and don't want to go it alone.   Or perhaps you've gone in the past, or in another city, but don't have a regular group to go back with. Maybe you would just like to meet others here in the city with similar interests for ideas on costumes, weapons, or just general discussion on related topics. Or it could be you're just looking for information on who, where and when these types of events happen. 

Whatever your reason, join us! Cheer on your favorite knight, indulge in decadent ales, the sweetest meads and interesting foods, gander at the beautiful lords and ladies in their finest garb, join the dances, hear the music, enjoy the sights, scents, wares and entertainment of Medieval Gotham!

- Eric, aka Ariq ibn Rajih ibn Khali al Turkir
results.name: Gotham Rennies

If you've recently moved back from college and are missing your old friends and having trouble making new ones, this is the group for you! We will do events like happy hours, dinners, bar crawls, bowling, and much more. Suggestions for events are welcome and encouraged. This is not a dating group, or a singles group, though hopefully some of you can find a special someone if you are looking. Please be mature, kind, open to meeting new people, have some education past high school, and be between the ages of 21 and 28. Invite your friends and lets prove that life after college doesn't have to suck!

results.description:
New York Business & Social Network

The Entrepreneurs, Professionals & Investors Network (EPI-Net) @ New York

We are 17,000 entrepreneurs, professionals and business owners with a variety of expertise and resources worldwide. We have built up quite a few active entrepreneurs communities globally in Silicon Valley, Toronto, London, Shanghai, Singapore, and else. Among us are also investors, recruiters, business owners, marketers, researchers, innovators, networkers, and graduate students.

Specialized groups and focus:

Social Media & Mobile Apps (Tech/Marketing/E-Commerce)

Mobile, Clouds & Emerging Technologies (Hi-Tech/3D)

Green (Energy & Environmental), Internet Security & Privacy, Biomedical (Health & Beauty Industries)...

Investors & Mentors | Young Professionals (TYPE)

Marketing & Branding | Startup/Dream Builders | GLOBAL IMPACTS


Affiliated Groups: Dream BIG (50,000 members worldwide)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The dreamers and the entrepreneurs, not government, built this economy, and they can once again make it strong. ~ Mitt Romney

Modern day startup do not necessarily need a lot of money. Rather, the key ingredients are the energy and talents of like-minded people as well as know-how and enabling resources. This group is for those of us dreamers with big ideas, who have actually been doing something to build up dreams, and ready for others (investors, mentors, or co-founders) to help make our dreams come true.

This group is about a combination of talented people, young or seasoned, with the ability to build the next big thing on the Internet or mobile world, and to change the world for better. The group will have technical, marketing, and content contributors, focused on a few topics at a time, with specific goals in mind.

Big dreams need not be restricted to Silicon Valley. With the talents and diversity of New Yokers, let's prove that we can build startups, and make something big that benefits the world.

A cool group of talents with lots of ambitions

Who do we have amongst us?

- Entrepreneurs & Innovators

- Engineers & Programmers

- Marketers & Financial Analysts

- Social Media Experts & Web Designers

- Investors & Mentors

- Tech Enthusiasts & Frontiers

- Legal & Insurance Professionals

- Researchers & Graduate students

Chris

Ph.D. in Electrical & Computer Engineering

International social entrepreneur

Organizer for EPI-Net, & else

E-mail: chris.meetup at hotmail.com


Together, We Can Achieve Something Great--Individually & Collectively

Core Values:

Life: Healthy, Successful, Fulfilling & Enjoyable

Achievement: Change the World for the Better While Making a Fortune

Social entrepreneurship:

Identifying or recognizing a social problem and using entrepreneurial principles to organize, create, and manage a social venture to achieve a desired social change.

Business entrepreneurs typically measure performance in profit and return, but social entrepreneurs also take into account a positive return to society.

Global collaboration for a better world:

Social entrepreneurship practiced in a world or international context is called international social entrepreneurship.

(Modified from Wikipedia)
results.name: New York Entrepreneurs

results.description:

This ISN'T the group for you if you're only looking to practice your Arabic (English-only speaking Arabs welcome!) or visit hookah (shisha) joints, and it's not a singles group (singles and couples welcome!). "As aspiring Software Craftsmen we are raising the bar of professional software development by practicing it and helping others learn the craft. Through this work we have come to value:

Not only working software, but also well-crafted software

Not only responding to change, but also steadily adding value

Not only individuals and interactions, but also a community of professionals

Not only customer collaboration, but also productive partnerships

That is, in pursuit of the items on the left we have found the items on the right to be indispensable. "

results.description: Entrepreneurs are pitching all the time.  And there's some really interesting research showing how we can do it a little bit better.  The starting point though is understanding the purpose of a pitch.  Now I used to think that the purpose of a pitch was basically to convert the other side.  You do a little vaudeville routine, ba da da da, and then they agree with you.  That's not right.  There's some great research out of the University of California Davis and Stanford.  And what they found is the most effective pitchers didn't think of their pitch as an attempt to convert.  They looked at it as an invitation to collaborate.  It was an invitation, come on in with me and work on this idea, share with me your ideas on how we can make this better.  That's what a pitch is.  So don't think of it as an attempt to convert, think of it as an invitation to collaborate.
results.name: Pitch Your Startup (LIVE!)

results.description: Glad you found us! NY Tri-state SociABILITY, also known as Friday Night Live,  is for high functioning young adults, 21-29, seeking friendships and activities.  We changed the name since our activities take place on various days.  Some of our members have Aspergers, or learning disabilities, but are physically and mentally capable and eager to engage in the same activities as other young adults. Our sons/daughters go bowling, to the movies, plays, tubing, hiking, have even walked Manhattan's West Side bike path, and many drive. While family members often help plan outings, and arrange transportation for non-driving members, the young adults already possess the social skills to enjoy themselves without the presence of parents/caregivers. Please note, if you, your young adult, has more significant needs, this may not be the appropriate group, as we do not have any professional staff, just people gathering together for social time. This is a group run by, and for, our young adults, with a little organizational help from us caregivers. If your son/daughter wants to make friends to hang out with on the weekend, come join!

Whether the goal is to help people save more money, get in shape, cut down on electricity usage, or learn a new language, the idea is the same:  how can we use research in behavioral economics and psychology to help users build habits and change their daily behavior?

results.description:
Who We Are

Education Idea Exchange NYC is a community of Educators, Entrepreneurs, Designers and Developers (as well as other Education Disruptors) who come together to foster innovation and disruption in the education space. This meetup is organized by 4.0 Schools, a nonprofit that brings together a similar community of people experimenting with new ideas in education -- from educators, entrepreneurs and creative technologists to parents and students.

Our Monthly Event 

In the first part of the night, 3-5 members working on an education venture or experiment share their progress, and get* feedback and help from the other meetup members. In the second half of the night, we open the floor for members to share what they can give* or what they need to get* (expertise, connections, feedback, etc).

get*:
• Feedback on your idea / prototype / MVP / venture
• People excited enough about your idea to join your team
• Connected to the 4.0 community (and the wider education disruption community in NYC)

give*:
• Your perspective on a problem and a potential solution 
 • Advice (pedagogy, problem validation, customer dev, feedback loops, product, etc)
 • Skills/time to ideas and people that really resonate with you
 • Access to your own network

If interested in sharing your venture or experiment, please fill out this form.
results.name: Education Idea Exchange NYC

results.description:

Share nail art, ideas, meet and greet, network within the industry

We will hold local shows at area venues to create opportunities to display your work and creativity! 

What better way to celebrate life than with beautiful nails, your best heels and of course a cocktail? It all started a few years ago in a nail salon. I loved the way my nails looked after they got done, but I hated waiting for the nail polish to dry. So I would buy the nail polish and try to polish them myself… Walah! Nail polish addict I became! How did the heels and cocktails come in? I wanted to make it a complete componet and lifestyle. Women love to have beautiful nails, gorgeous shoes and they love to go out. When they go out with their girlfriends they usually have cocktails! Hence The birth of Glam Nails, Heels and Cocktails.

Marsha B.

Are you interested in:

results.description:
Come join us for our weekly NYC Small Business Owners, Consultants & Salespeople meetup.  These meetings promise to be fun, full of energy & productive!

We differentiate ourselves from all other groups by not only introducing ourselves to the group but also by acting as a small business advisory group. Need help with a business problem or issue? We can help. We have been together for over 15 years and are always growing. Come join us.

We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome salespeople, entrepreneurs, individual practitioners and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each other’s professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.) 

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (917-862-8929) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM. Networking takes place from 8-8:15. The actual meeting and introductions are between 8:15 and 9:30. And then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once a month we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:

http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors

1290 Avenue of the Americas, 4th Floor

(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)

We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.

Raphi Salem (917-862-8929)

Please contact me if you have any thoughts, comments, suggestions etc:

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet
www.SalemGlobal.com
917-862-8929

results.description:
Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually.  We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

Our community boasts of women from all walks of life.  From the mom-preneur to the business professional to the stay at home mom; our platform and unique community of “nice girls” creates genuine connections that support the creation and building of close relationships.

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”:  that is, one of your own design!  We believe you should ENVISION your story (and the ending it should have), EXPLORE life with friends, and EVOLVE in to the woman you dare and dream to be.  Find your passion in life. Feel fulfilled. Feel pretty. Feel powerful.  Make a new girlfriend (or five).  The Lady Savant Community is here to help you on your journey.

Our Lady Savants connect and collaborate through private events, an online forum,  and one on one interaction through Savanting Circles (mastermind group). Our members have access to a vast network of women from a multitude of various professions and life experiences. Establishing relationships within this network opens doors and stimulates conversation resulting in the creation of new ideas and close bonds. We are a community that believes in and supports the power of the female spirit.

Are you asking yourself is Lady Savant the right club for you?  If you answer YES to any of the questions below then you are in the right place:

** I want to be inspired to do something more, but I don’t know exactly what?

** I want to make true friendships.

** I need to network and meet other women business owners.

** I don’t work, but I want to learn and explore other options out there.

** I like to volunteer and help others.

** I want to take up a hobby or learn about new trades.

** I like to buy local and support women in following their passions.

** I want to find myself and passions:  spiritually, physically, and mentally.

If you answered YES to any of these questions, Lady Savant is right for you!  Come to our next event (you may attend one event before applying for membership), meet some of the amazing members, and join !  Don’t let another day slip away….this could be the door to your next Chapter in your life.
results.name: Lady Savant: An Elite Women's Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Welcome! We're a group of young women who get together monthly in a small group (10-15 ladies) to discuss a good book and enjoy some wine. We also occassionally have "no reading required" events in addition to regular book club meetings to include more members and try something new! If you're interested in meeting some new friends, please join us!

Fast Facts:

-Meetups are the second Wednesday of each month.

-It's not necessary that you finish the book by the meetup, but be prepared for some spoilers!

-Most of us eat dinner during the meetup, so feel free to come hungry.

-We're really a very fun and friendly group, so if you're on the fence, give us a shot!

Ground Rules:

-Members who don't attend a meetup after RSVP-ing yes and failing to change their RSVP to no will be removed after three such "no-shows."

-Inactive members (not in attendance at any meetups) will be removed after 6 months of inactivity.


2016 Book List

January- Me Before You by Jojo Moyes

February- A Map of the World by Jane Hamilton

March- The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins

April- Bel Canto by Ann Patchett

May- The Brief and Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao by Junot Diaz

June- We Were Liars by E. Lockhart

July- I'll Give You the Sun by Jandy Nelson

August- Pretty Girls- Karen Slaughter

September- Infinite Home by Kathleen Alcott

October- In a Dark, Dark Wood- Ruth Ware Kitchens of the Great Midwest- J. Ryan Stradal

November- Kitchens of the Great Midwest- J. Ryan Stradal

December- Moriarty by Anthony Horowitz
results.name: Young Women's Book and Wine Club

results.description:
The main goal of Ladies of Gotham is to create a safe space for women to get together and play board/card games. Our group is trans, cis, and genderfluid friendly; it is open and welcome to all women and all persons who fall outside of the gender binary.

Are you new to board gaming? Or maybe a seasoned pro? All levels of experience are welcome! Our meetups will be a chance for members to share their favorite games as well as learn some new ones. This group is a great opportunity to make some new friends over some of the best games out there. 

In order to ensure a safe space for you, our anti-harrassment policy is as follows:

Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming is dedicated to providing a harassment-free safe space for all of its members, regardless of gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of members in any form or from any source, be it from within the group or outside of it.

Members that feel like their experience/safety with the group has been compromised are encouraged to contact the organizer(s) directly. A member of this meetup is entitled to support and help from this group’s organizing team. As well as privacy and confidentiality with any and all issues reported to organizers as the reporting member(s) sees fit.

Members (or organizers) violating this code of conduct may be expelled from the group at the discretion of the group’s organizing team. 

(This anti-harassment policy is based on the example policy from the Geek Feminism wiki, created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers.

http://geekfeminism.wikia.com/wiki/Conference_anti-harassment)

Meetups run 1-2 times monthly with a variety of different games played at each meetup. Suggestions for games are always appreciated!

Donations to the meetup group go towards paying yearly Meetup subscription fees. Any excess amount goes towards purchasing games. 

Have a game you like that's already been played in the past? Let me know so I know to put it back into the rotation soon.
results.name: Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming

POLICY

results.description:
The Network is a guild of writers, all based in NYC. Our mission is to unite the writers of NYC by offering them direct access to people as equally passionate about the craft. We are a society, a community, and a family. 

Members of NYCWN benefit from a constant support system of, and endless opportunities to interact and share with, as well as learn from fellow writers.

We meet weekly.  We begin with a guided meditation, sharing and a group self-inquiry process in which we support each other with our words.  We use a specific process for the group self-inquiry.  I learned this process from Swami Shankarananda who is located in Australia.  Detailed information about this process can be found in the "Pages" section of this Meetup.  Recommended books for self-inquiry are "Happy for No Good Reason" and "Self Inquiry,"  both by Swami Shankarananda.
